title: Altria, Fannie Mae, Nike: Stocks That Defined the Week
text:
Altria Group Inc.

Waiting for the smoke to clear surrounding the future of Juuling, tobacco giants Altria Group and Philip Morris International Inc. called off talks about merging after a decade apart. The discussions were spurred in part by the threat from the trendy smoking alternative to their traditional businesses. Juul Labs Inc.’s chief executive abruptly stepped down on Wednesday amid U.S. efforts to combat underage vaping. He was succeeded by an executive at Altria, which owns a 35% stake in the e-cigarette maker. Altria shares fell 0.5% Wednesday while Philip Morris shares gained 5.2%.

...
description: U.S. stock benchmarks fell on the week; here are seven of the biggest companies whose stocks moved on news.
